name: src/altInstance.js
src/BindHandlers.js
BindHandlers
description:
Creates a decorator for binding action handlers to a store.
A binding is created for each action that has a matching handler method mapping.

The decorator takes any number of action handler definitions as arguments and applies their
bindings after concatinating them to a flat list, so you can pass either of these:
- an array of handler definitions
- any number of array of handler definitions
- any number of handlerdefinitions without arrays
- any mixed variation

See manual/usage/action-handlers.md for more on this topic.

name: src/callFactory.js
src/callSeries.js
callSeries
description:
Returns a promise and executes a series of functions that each return a promise.
Uses an initial 0-timeout so that we don't run into "Cannot dispatch in the middle of a dispatch" errors in case
one of the calls triggers a `loading` action

params.name: calls
params.description: An array of function that each returns a promise

params.name: options
params.description: An object with additional options

params.name: options.log
params.description: Whether to log each individual call to the console

return.description: A promise that will be resolved when all calls succeeded or rejected if at least one call failed

name: src/createAction.js
createAction
description:
Creates a single action with a namespace.
Basically just like `altx.generateActions`, but with a signle required argument `name` and an optional second argument `namespace`.

Note: The returned object is very much the same as with the plural version `createActions`: You get back an object that has
a function by the name you gave as well as an constant for the action name.

params.name: name
params.description: The name to use for the action

params.name: namespace
params.description: The namespace to use for the action

name: src/createActions.js
createActions
description:
Creates simple (data-pass-through) actions with a namespace.
Basically just like `alt.generateActions`, but within a given namespace instead of 'global'.

params.name: namespace
params.description: The namespace to use for the actions

params.name: actions
params.description: An array of action names

return.description: An object containing the generated actions and constants

name: src/createStore.js
src/decorators/bindActions.js
bindActions
description: Decorates a store with any number of viewAction definitions.

name: src/decorators/bindCalls.js
bindCalls
description: Decorates a store with any number of call definitions.

name: decorateStoreWithCall
description:
Decorates a store with a single call definition.
Attaches the dataSource specified in the call definition using alt's datasource decorator.
Creates and binds a handler function for all reducers and actions specified in the call definition.

name: bindReducerHandler
description:
Attaches a single reducer handling to the store.
A new handler method will be created on the store for each action associated
with a reducer (defaults to the action names: loading, error, success). Each handler will pass
the current state and the action payload to the reducer with the same name
and mutate the store with the new state returned by the reducer.
Any sideEffects defined in the call will be executed with a ({state, prevState, payload}) signature.

name: src/decorators/bindHandlers.js
bindHandlers
description: Decorates a store with any number of action handlers.

name: attachBoundHandler
description:
Attaches a single reducer handling to the store.

A new handler method will be created on the store class.
The handler method invokes the reducer giving it the current store state.
It then sets the reducer result as the new store state.

If a sideEffect function is defined, it will be called with the signature `{state, prevState, payload}`

params.name: storeClass
params.description: The class of the store to be decorated

params.name: action
params.description: An altjs action

params.name: handler
params.description: An handler object with `{name[, reducer, sideEffect]}`

name: src/decorators/bindStorage.js
bindStorage
description:
Decorator for ImmutableStore to persist values across browser refresh.

Supports `window.localStorage` and `window.sessionStorage` as well as `localForage` or any other backend that implements the [Web Storage API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Storage_API).
The storage backend may return promises for asynchronous usage.

To store only specific parts of the state, provide a `keyPaths` array. Omit `keyPaths` to persist the entire state of the store.

params.name: options.keyPaths
params.description: An array of keyPaths. Each keyPath can be an array of strings as used in Immutable.js, e.g. `['foo', 'bar']` or a string with dot delimiters, e.g. `'foo.bar'`

params.name: options.storage
params.description: An object that supports the [Web Storage API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Storage_API) methods

params.name: options.parse
params.description: A function that receives the persisted value and returns the data object. Defaults to `JSON.parse` if `storage` is an instance of `window.Storage`

params.name: options.encode
params.description: A function that receives the data object and returns the value to be persisted. Defaults to `JSON.stringify` if `storage` is an instance of `window.Storage`

params.name: options.logging
params.description: Whether to log details to the console during operations

return.description: The decorator function for the target store

name: src/decorators/connect.js
connect
description:
A component decorator for connecting to immutable stores.

Basically a wrapper around `alt/utils/connectToStores`.  
Adds the necessary static methods `getStores()` and `getPropsFromStores()` to the decorated component.

- Supports multiple stores.
- Supports a simplified, string-based access to stores, with optional renaming of props.
- Supports more flexible, redux-like access to stores using mapper functions.

### String notation

params.name: definitions
params.description: A list of objects that each define a store connection

name: parseAccessor

params.name: string
params.description: The value accessor passed by the component decorator.

return.description: result.propName - name for the prop as expected by the component

name: src/getSources.js
src/handlerFactory.js
src/ImmutableStore.js
constructor
description: Creates the instance.

params.name: initialData
params.description: Plain or immutable data object for the initial data of this store. When `reset()` is called, the state is reverted to this data.

params.name: options
params.description: Options object

params.name: options.env
params.description: Pass `process.env` so that the instance can refresh the alt devtool when `NODE_ENV === 'development'` is detected

params.name: options.listName
params.description: Name of the list entry to use in the `getItemById`, the `getIndexById` and the `find` methods.

name: change
description:
Changes a property to a new value.
There are three modes of calling this function:

__change('key', value)__
changes one property of the state object.
see:
https://facebook.github.io/immutable-js/docs/#/Map/set

__change({key: value, ...})__
changes any number of state properties at once

https://facebook.github.io/immutable-js/docs/#/Map/mergeDeep

__change({id:5}, {key: value})__
changes any number of properties on any matching item within a list

name: changeItem
description: Changes a specific item in a list within the state object.

params.name: filter.item
params.description: An object that specifies key/value pairs that must be matched by list items, e.g. {id: 13}

params.name: filter.list
params.description: The name of the list to search in. Defaults to 'items'

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing key/value pairs for data to be set at matched items

throws.description: Error if when no item could be found

name: find
description: Returns a list of items that match a filter.

unknown.tagValue: {List} A new immutable list that only contains items that matched all key/value pairs of `filter`

params.name: listName
params.description: The name of the list within the state object.

params.name: filter
params.description: An object with key/value pairs to test items against

return.description: A new immutable list that only contains items that matched all key/value pairs of `filter`

name: src/utils/logging.js
NONE

name: ALLOW

name: FORCE
description: Always log, regardless of `logging` in definition
